info.title: Microsoft Kaizala
info.description: Microsoft Kaizala is a mobile app that helps you connect with your entire mobile workforce and supply chain, organize and allocate tasks more efficiently with built-in and custom Actions, and get actionable information and insights to accelerate decision-making.

tags.name: Authentication APIs
tags.description: These APIs help in gaining access for 3rd party systems to interact with Kaizala API platform. Kaizala implements custom token based authorization mechanism. This mechanism uses the concept of Refresh and Access Tokens to manage access authorization for the Kaizala Platform APIs. /n

tags.name: Group Management APIs
tags.description: These APIs allow group admin(s) to access group resources and manage group memberships accordingly.

tags.name: Content Creation APIs
tags.description:
API end-point to send instances of Kaizala Actions to conversation groups inside Kaizala.
Current scope is to support following action types:
Action POST Supported Id
Picture Attachment Yes image
Audio Attachment Yes audio
Document Attachment Yes document
Contact Attachment No N/A
Job Yes Job
Survey Yes survey
Photo with Location No photoWithLocation
Let's Meet Yes LetsMeet
Quick Poll Yes Poll
Share Location No shareLocation
Request Location No N/A
Live Location No N/A
Announcement Yes Announcement

tags.name: Content Query APIs
tags.description:
These set of APIs retrieve the list of action instances sent to a group
Action GET Supported Id
Picture Attachment Yes image
Audio Attachment No audio
Document Attachment Yes document
Contact Attachment No N/A
Job Yes Job
Survey Yes survey
Photo with Location Yes photoWithLocation
Let's Meet Yes LetsMeet
Quick Poll Yes Poll
Share Location Yes shareLocation
Request Location No N/A
Live Location No N/A
Announcement No Announcement

tags.name: Subscription Webhooks
tags.description:
Microsoft Kaizala API also provides a way for developers to register for specific events within the Kaizala platform via WebHooks.
WebHooks is a lightweight HTTP pattern providing a simple publisher/subscriber model for wiring together Web APIs and SaaS services. When an event happens in Kaizala, a notification is sent in the form of an HTTP POST request to registered subscribers. The POST request contains information about the event which makes it possible for the receiver to act accordingly.

Using WebHooks, you can subscribe to various events that occur within a conversation group context in Kaizala.

get.description: This API generates Access token to access Kaizala resources, when refresh token, Application/Connector Id and Application/Connector Secret is provided

parameters.description: Secret associated with the Connector

parameters.description: refreshToken shared by the Kaizala Group Admin when the respective Connector was granted access to the group

post.description:
This API allows creation of a a group, including Managed Public Groups. It takes array of string as input. Each string is mobile number(with country code). This API can take maximum of 100 mobile numbers as input.
	GroupType: Group/ConnectGroup. ConnectGroup for Managed public group.

parameters.name: accessToken
parameters.description: Access Token received from the auth end-point

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: application/json

request.body: {name:"Kaizala Test group", welcomeMessage:"Welcome to group created programmatically via Postman", members:["{{mobile-number-2}}"], groupType:"Group"}

API to create a group.
Optional parameters:

	GroupType: Group/ConnectGroup. ConnectGroup for Managed public group.

post.description: Subscribe to all events at action level
post.summary: Subscribe to all events at action level

parameters.name: accessToken
parameters.description: Access Token received from the auth end-point

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: application/json

request.body:
{  
   "objectId":"{{test-action-id}}",
   "objectType":"Action",
   "eventTypes":[  
      "ActionCreated",
      "ActionResponse"
   ],
   "callBackUrl":"https://requestb.in/12786un1",
   "callBackToken":"tokenToBeVerifiedByCallback",
   "callBackContext":"Any data which is required to be returned in callback. Current webhook data can be seen by refreshing: https://requestb.in/12786un1?inspect"
}

subGroups.description: Array of groups with the list of subGroups if any

example.name: Kaizala Test Public Group
example.welcomeMessage: Welcome to public group created programmatically via Postman

welcomeMessage.description: Welcome message which will be displayed to new group member

members.description: Mobile number(with country code) of members to be added. Default: Access token's user will be added as admin of the group

groupType.description: Enum: Group/ConnectGroup. ConnectGroup will create Managed Public group. Default: Group

PostCustomActionToAGroup[withProperties].title: Post custom action to a group [with properties]Request

properties.description: Each element of object[] is described below as Property Object. Only valid for creating Action Package Instance

value.description: Type of the property. Enum: Text, Numeric, Location, DateTime, StringList, Attachment, StringSet, AttachmentList

PostAJobOnAGrouprequest.title: Post a job on a groupRequest

assignedTo.description: Array of mobile numbers for the persons to whom Job is assigned

dueDate.description: Default: 24hrs. Number of hours before which job should be completed

caption.description: Text Message that would be sent along with the Image

mediaResource.description: MediaResource string from a previous call to /media where you need to upload the attachment

SubscribeToAllEventsAtActionLevelWithAct.title: Subscribe to all events at action level with action package idRequest

example.callBackContext: Any data which is required to be returned in callback. Current webhook data can be seen by refreshing: https://requestb.in/12786un1?inspect

objectId.description: Identifier representing the object in which context the webhooks need to be created.For ObjectType=Group, its group's Identifier, For ObjectType=Action, its actionId, For ObjectType=ActionPackage, its action-package-id

eventTypes.description: Array of different types of events you need to subscribe the webhook to. Supported events are: ActionCreated,ActionResponse,SurveyCreated,JobCreated,SurveyResponse,JobResponse,TextMessageCreated,AttachmentCreated,Announcement,MemberAdded,MemberRemoved,GroupAdded,GroupRemoved

callBackUrl.description: HTTPS URL to which the subscribed events need to be notified to

callBackToken.description: Optional parameter you can set which will be sent in the HTTP header 'kz-callback-token' with every callBack made by the WebHook

callBackContext.description: Optional parameter you can set which will be sent in the JSON payload as 'context' with every callBack made by the WebHook

SendMessageToSubscriber(s)InAPublicGroup.title: Send message to subscriber(s) in a public groupRequest

Message.description: Text message to be sent (Max limit of 1000 Characters)

subscribers.description: Each element corresponds to a mobile number(with country code. Eg. +911999999999). Text message will be sent only to the selected subscribers. To be used for selective communication to subscribers in context of a Public Group

sendToAllSubscribers.description: Default: false. Valid only in case the groupId belongs to a Public Group. True to send the text message to all subscribers which requires the token's user to be admin of the Public Group

members.description: Array of phone numbers(with countrycode) of new members to be added

Supported events are: ActionCreated,ActionResponse,SurveyCreated,JobCreated,SurveyResponse,JobResponse,TextMessageCreated,AttachmentCreated,Announcement,MemberAdded,MemberRemoved,GroupAdded,GroupRemoved

callBackUrl.description: HTTPS URL to which the subscribed events need to be notified to

callBackToken.description: Optional parameter you can set which will be sent in the HTTP header 'kz-callback-token' with every callBack made by the WebHook
